level.text: 530.1 Each EMS education program, with the exception of Emergency Medicalesponder education programs, provided by an EMS educational institution shallrovide students with access to field internships with appropriate medicalversight and supervision within any District-approved Emergency Medicalervices Agency. Each internship shall include:
Additional components as required by the National Education Standards; and
Additional components as may be required by DOH.
530.2 If the field internship is located outside the District of Columbia, theducational institution offering the education program of which the internships a part shall:
Comply with the laws of the state where the field internships are located; and
Notify the appropriate EMS officials in the state where the field internshipsre located of the presence of program students in those internships.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Rules of the Board of Public Welfare issued July 28, 1950; as amended oneptember 29, 1950; as amended by Final Rulemaking published at 60 DCR 16569December 6, 2013).
